column6: Notes
column7: Files extracted from the PC version of KH 1.5 + 2.5, credit for Track Descriptions goes to Sonicshadowsilver2 from the KH2 Rando discord

column6: Japanese translation of the name is the same as Tchaikovsky's opera
"nemureru mori no bijou"
I guess the Land of Departure was considered Keyblade training grounds?
This is the same word as "shugyo" in BH6
"shirayuki hime"
Interesting that it's not named after the movie like other Disney world themes - maybe "peter" would be confused with Pete's theme
Funny that the abbreviation is "lilo" when only stitch is featured
The Badlands in Japanese are "mysterious wastelands" using the same kanji
Filename is a bit of a weird mashup - it's for disney icecream, and it's a field theme, but not both at the same time. also, the other ice cream themes have different names and appear later
As in digital communication, between players for multiplayer, as befits the Mirage Arena field theme
Same designation as "Piccolo Resto" from COM, worth noting "La Pace" uses a similar word with slightly different connotations, "yuttari"
To be clear that's literally the first English synonym Jisho gives me, not necessarily a reference to the existing track
As in stress, not to be confused with how colloquially in Japanese "high tension" can mean high energy. Same designation as "Face It!" from COM
Love how this word has a bunch of synonyms that mean different, important things in KH specifically
Version of "At Dusk I Will Think of You" used for the Lea/Isa cameo appearance

Interesting note here: Japanese formally lacks a "va" sound, and approximates it with "ba", which is what the short name here is doing, but there is a way to designate a "va" sound in loanwords, and that's what the full Japanese word for Unversed does
Could be Ansem Battle, Japanese ambiguates th/s (see FF7 Flower Girl). Either meaning is interesting but still leaves this track a bit ??? as the FotU replacement
Interesting that Unbreakable Chains -> Dismiss is seen as the final battle sequence, with Another Side and Rage Awakened coming much later
"han" for Rowdy Rumble and Shrouding Dark Cloud could mean the same thing?
Never mind that Destiny's Force has a specific purpose this game ignored...
lmao "peet"
Org XIII = Braig? Notable that Xigbar's theme in DDD is an Org 13 arrangement
this naming scheme being the inverse of the official track names amuses me
Unsure why two versions, or what 128/132 mean
Same name as Land of Departure tracks above
Not to be confused with "syugyo", the land of departure. unused
Unsure, same as Hanyo above? in which case lol rowdy rumble generic. Notably used for "generic"-seeming themes in KH3 as well
Being so short, "han" could be short for a lot of things. One meaning Jisho suggests is 班 "team", which makes sense for this track, used for Arena battles, but not Rowdy Rumble
Interesting that these three tracks abbreviate battle as "bt" and not "b"
EtV being a generic boss theme ishimoto whipped up explains why it has no motivic connections to vanitas
Used when you hover over the game icon on PSP? To be clear these are the PC version files but stuff seems to be preserved: see also Days having music from the game that's not in the movie
The document assembled by the rando devs calls this Battle ver., but I disagree. I wonder what "short" means? As in "short film"? For the secret movie?
Ice-Cream Beat
Ice-Cream Beat
Ice-Cream Beat

This term, "enigmatic man", seems to be used for all cloaked figures of uncertain identity, notably including both MF and KH1's "Unknown" Xemnas boss. It's interesting that the English community disambiguates.

column2: Ambient Wind Sounds from Destroyed Land of Departure
column6: Notably not syugyo, does this only play in BBS international/final mix? would make sense that english name is decided by then
Interesting that these are in proper English and not romanised Japanese, see also dp_amb above
Pure -> Pureblood is my speculation
If not for context this could easily be "Monster"
